user_message:
<misra_rule>
MISRA C 2023 Rule 2.1 is: A project shall not contain unreachable code.

</misra_rule>
<response format>
Provide your answer with these fields.
- is_rule_violated: whether the rule is violated or not (true/false),
- scenario: a specific violation scenario.
</response format>
<target_code>
Here is the code of reply_with_area2_pages:
```c
static enum MHD_Result
reply_with_area2_pages (struct MHD_Connection *c,
                        const char *url)
{

  if (0 == strcmp (url, SEC_AREA2_URL ""))
  {
    static const char page_content[] =
      "<html><head><title>Very restricted secret page</title></head>" \
      "<body>Welcome to the super restricted area</body></html>";
    static const size_t page_content_len =
      (sizeof(page_content) / sizeof(char)) - 1;
    struct MHD_Response *resp;
    enum MHD_Result ret;

    resp = MHD_create_response_from_buffer_static (page_content_len,
                                                   page_content);
    if (NULL == resp)
      return MHD_NO;

    /* Ignore possible error when adding the header as the reply will work even
       without this header. */
    (void) MHD_add_response_header (resp, MHD_HTTP_HEADER_CONTENT_TYPE,
                                    "text/html");

    ret = MHD_queue_response (c, MHD_HTTP_OK, resp);
    MHD_destroy_response (resp);
    return ret;
  }
  /* If needed: add handlers for other URLs in this area */
#if 0 /* Disabled code */
  if (0 == strcmp (url, SEC_AREA2_URL "other_path/other_page"))
  {
    /* Add page creation/processing code */
  }
#endif /* Disabled code */

  /* The requested URL is unknown */
  return reply_with_page_not_found (c);
}
```
</target_code>
<target_code>
Here is the code fragment that you need to analyze:
```c
#if 0 /* Disabled code */
  if (0 == strcmp (url, SEC_AREA2_URL "other_path/other_page"))
  {
    /* Add page creation/processing code */
  }
#endif /* Disabled code */
```
Focus on the above code fragment and judge whether it violates the rule 2.1 or not.
</target_code>
scenario: The if-block is wrapped in #if 0 ... #endif so it is removed by the preprocessor and not part of the translation unit; therefore it is not unreachable code at compile / run time and does not violate MISRA C 2023 Rule 2.1. Note: keeping disabled code in source is discouraged for maintainability — if the block were compiled but could never be executed (for example, placed after an unconditional return or guarded by a condition that is always false in the build), that would constitute a Rule 2.1 violation.
